column1: I have a Samsung Galaxy 4 , and definitely did not want to break it or crack the screen , this Case is just what I needed for the protection of my phone . Very durable and covers it up nicely . Definitely would recommend this product to anyone who has an S4 and wants to protect it .
Fits the s4 like a glove ! Very easy to put on the phone . Perfect for protecting my purchase from life ! Highly recommend . Plus it looks great and is n't bulky like other Otter Box cases .
Otter Box is the ultimate case for protecting your mobile phone . I like the commuter case because it has a slim look and still provides max protection .
Amazing case for my Galaxy s4 . It looks durable , protective and do not make my cell to look bigger than it really is . It fits perfectly on the Galaxy s4 . Just buy it !

This is for the Otterbox Commuter Series case for Samsung Galaxy S4 . The fit is perfect . Installation was a complete snap without any problems . It does n't add much weight to my cell phone ( which I was afraid it would do ) . While I have n't dropped it so I can not attest to its protectiveness , it is a great case . All of the holes leading to the charger , speaker , etc line up correctly . To charge , simple flip down the protective plastic which covers up the connection . It has built in covers for the volume control and off and on button . Both work great and I have not had any issues . The camera opening is also lined up perfectly and I have not had any issues with it . As an added plus , it came with a protective face shield that was extremely easy to apply . It does not get in the way of the sensors and works great.I have a white Galaxy S4 and wanted to retain the white without adding bulk or changing the color . This does the perfect job . The only issue I have with it is that I can not locate a holster that will work with it . I am a woman and do n't always carry my purse with me , so this is an issue .
This case is perfect amount of rubber case and touch shell . light weight . protects charge and audio port . Good investment

I have been using Outterbox Commuter cases for a few years now . This case fits the S4 perfectly . There are no lose fittings . All the ports and buttons are covered , port covers do stay in place when not in use . The two piece case is easy to take off , but more of a challenge to put back on . ( Gets easier with practice . ) I started out with the all black case , but when I saw this color , could n't resist getting it . It does add some bulk to the phone , but not much . It feels good in the hand as well . I have know worries when I drop my phone , of it getting damaged .
Great fit , nice looking and protects my wifes samsung galaxy s 4 . We love otter box protectors they workas designed ! ! !

I like everything about this case except the firmness of the rubber/silicone insert . It is rather stiff , which makes the power and volume buttons rather hard to press ( you sure wo n't press them accidentally ! ) .The color is nice , the design is nice , and the fit and feel is great . If they must use such a high durometer insert , they should make the material over the buttons a little thinner to make them easier to press .

I was suprised at the color , it 's not even remotely close to the color pink I expected , it 's neon pink . The other surprise was how heavy it makes my light phone . I 've had other cases like this ( non Otterbox ) that were made with rubber and a plastic case but they were n't as heavy as this one.I think it will provide good protection , but I think I paid for the brand here , I do n't feel like this will provide any more protection than cheaper cases of the same type .

I have been searching for a case for my Galaxy S4 that did not take away from the slimline look of my phone but yet offers great protection . This case is exactly what I have been searching for , my phone not only looks great but is completely protected !
Gives your case good protection , looks great I had the commuter case for the S3 but this one looks and feels a lot better . I recommend This case not just for looks but for protection .

As soon as it was received I tried it on my Samsung Galaxy S4 . It fits perfect on my phone and provides a strong protection against any kind of falls . I have always a good grip , will not slip from your hands as with other brands may occur . The power and volume buttons have not given me any kind of problems to use them with this case on my cellphine . I totally recommend it for a great protection .

Just switched from an iPhone to the Samsung Galaxy S4 and this is the 4th case I 've bought . My favorite so far . Got the CM4 , Spigen Slim Armor , And Samsung protective case and this is by far the best and most protective ! Had the Commuter for the iPhone and did n't like them , but this fits perfectly for the GS4 and even included a screen protector that went on perfectly with the first try ! Does n't add much bulk and the color is great . Would absolutely recommend to anyone !
I have researched this case and it is the best protection bar none . It fits well and slides easily in and out of your pocket .
I bought this item to my girl friend , she love the color and its a robust structure and most important , the fashion look in its S4 .

I thought the otterbox I had with my S3 was gone and then came you : - ) . I am more than pleased with this purchase to say the least . The construction and fit of the otterbox with my S4 is perfect . The look really compliments the phone . The screen protector is also of high quality and worked out great considering that I am no expert at applying screen protectors . Great Job !

This is my 2nd Otterbox Commuter case . I have one for the S3 which is also excellent but a bit difficult to put on and take off . Very tight fit.This case has provided just as much protection as the S3 version and is easier to put on and take off so I would say it 's an improvement over the S3 version .
My wife loves the style and protection this gives her Galaxy S4 Phone . I highly recommend this and other products from OtterBox .

Love my otter box . I 'm not in the habit of dropping my phone , but it happens . I do n't want to end up with a cracked screen and then pay a lot of money to get it fixed . The otter box works . Just wish it can in some pretty designs .

I purchased this in black for my S4 . I 'll give the case 5 stars for quality , fit , protection and function . The screen protector , not so much . My recommendation is YES , buy this case but buy another screen protector . I purchased the SPIGEN SGP Ultra Crystal for mine and I love it.The case fits perfectly and the phones buttons work great with the case installed . My wife has the Defender case for her Galaxy S3 . She is a klutz and requires the extra protection afforded by that beefier case . I chose the commuter because of it 's lower profile . The commuter also lacks the 'sticky ' silicone corner pads which seem to cling to the inside of pockets . The Commuter case seems to provide all the protection I 'll need with the added benefit of sliding in and out of my pocket with ease.I did make a modification to the case already . The USB connection on the phone is protected by a flap which seals very nicely when it 's closed . However , when the phone is plugged in ( as mine is most of the time ) that cover is unsightly to me and gets in the way . It 's a personal preference thing so I cut it off . It 's worth noting that I thought I could simply rip it off along the hinge by tearing the thinner material there . I could n't ... The plastic is very tough so no worries about the plastic flaps coming off on their own because of use . Removal required a sharp utility knife ( or similar ) . I left the cover over the headphone jack because I use it less frequently . It seals tightly and stay closed rather than flapping around and opening on it 's own.It has all the necessary holes in all the correct places so as not to impede the functions of the phone . It seems to provide all the protection I need while not being too obtrusive . The screen protector is the weak link here otherwise this is a 5-star product.UPDATE : It 's been a couple months since I first reviewed this case . In that time I 've dropped my phone onto pavement and other hard surfaces without damage . I am certain this case has saved the phone from destruction .

This fits my phone perfectly . I saw some reviews talking about a loose fit and I was worried , but I never had an issues . I used the Defender on the iphones in the past and was sick of a heavy/clunky phone and this keeps my phone safe and sound and fits easily in my pocket . Will it protect my phone like a Defender from Otterbox ... no , but I do n't plan on dropping it out the window .
It protects very well ! I would recommend it to others who are looking for an excellent case at a decent cost .

This is n't my first Otterbox for a reason . They make a great case . Easy to take on and off . I have purchased the Commuter model for my older phones and they have protected my phone very well against many drops . I have purchased the Defender for my wife and kids . It too is a great case , but I prefer the Commuter . If you do n't need the ability to clip your phone to your belt , definitely go with the Commuter . It adds very little bulk to the phone , but still protects very well . The hard plastic shell allows it to slide easily in and out of pockets , unlike sticky silicon skinned cases . Great fit and protection for my new Galaxy S4 .

The protector certainly does it 's job . I love that but the hybrid nature of it seems ... to not fit properly . You put the hard shell over the soft side and it squeezes so hard a bit of the soft rim comes a bit apart from the rest as you slide it in and out of your pocket . Otherwise , it falls and protects the phone in an A-1 manner .

I have tried several phone cases for my Samsung Galaxy S4 , and prior to the OtterBox Commuter Series Case they have all been garbage at protecting my beloved gadget from my spastic meat hooks.I am a clumsy human being , and I need to protect my valuable possessions from my inherent clumsiness . The OtterBox Commuter Series Case has a soft , rubbery inner cover that acts as a shock-absorber and a rugged hard plastic outer cover to act like a medieval knight 's plate armor . The cutouts and button covers all line up well , and I 've noticed no sacrifice of functionality like I have with some of my previous cases . My phone is now well suited for the half-dozen daily drops onto concrete it has the pleasure to experience.My only complaint about this product , and the reason I did n't give it a 5 star review , is that the included screen protector is a nightmare to install . The instructions were inadequate at depicting all the necessary steps in applying the screen protector to one 's phone display , and the pull-tabs to remove the film from the front and back of the protective panel pulled away from the film ( instead of taking the film with them ) and thus required me to struggle at getting said films off the protector.Overall , this is a great case . Even if you just throw away the screen protector , this case is a great value to any klutz like me .

I felt a little uncomfortable with my S4 , it is so small and thin . I was concerned about dropping it.Anyway , this case is so cool . It 's easy to hold the phone , and it does n't add any appreciable weight or bulk.I did look at the Samsung case too . The flap over the front was of interest , but in the end it did n't seem as usable.Oh , and I did not install the so called screen protector . The phone has gorilla glass , why would you want to muck with it ? Screen protectors always diminish display quality , and I question that they will protect your phone screen when you drop it . Of course , installing it is your options.The case is great .

I purchased this case for my wifes Galaxy S4 . I had looked at the Otterbox website and according to there website they had not released these colores yet in Silver and Pink . I did not want the black nor the white with gray for her so I decided to see if by chance anyone had any of the other colors . To my surprise they did . I contacted the company first to see if they actually had it in stock and not backorderd . They replied quickly as in stock . I placed the order and received it with in three days . I am very pleased with the customer service and there quick shipping.The otterbox itself is really nice . My wife seems to really like it . I have the S3 with an otterbox as well and there are a couple of things that I noticed right away . First , was the volume and power pushers . On this new model they are perfect , not hard like on the S3 but not to soft either . I was really pleased about that but the one thing that does have me a little worried is that on the S3 the outer hard plastic goes around the pushers just leaving the corners exposed with the rubber and on the S4 the hard plastic ends underneath the volume and power pushers , leaving more of an area with just the rubber . To me atleast , it just seems like the S3 has better protection with the outer hard plastic going all the way up . I 'm not sure if it was made this way so they can make the pushers softer or for better grip but in any case that is what I noticed and thought I should mention it . Besides that , the rest of the case is wonderful . It 's not to bulky and has a good feel to it . I would trust this case over most others . I am just wainting for them to realease the other colors like the silver and blue for me to purchase as I just got an S4 for myself .

I purchased my Otterbox off of Ebay for about $ 5 less ( I know how Ebay can be but yes it 's a real Otterbox , from a USA seller . ) Anyways , so that 's just to let you know that I will not be rating the seller of this product , or shipping , JUST the case itself.I purchased the `` Marine '' color . By the stock Otterbox photos of the case ( which both this Amazon listing and the Ebay listing use ) I fully expected grey hard case and black soft case . However , for others purchasing the Marine color , the inner soft case is actually a very dark blue , a color which none of the stock photos seem to show well . So I took my own photo to give a more realistic idea of the colors there . It was n't an issue with me , so I kept it.The screen protector that came with the case works very well . I have no dust or bubbles showing , and it fits perfectly . However , unfortunately the top corners were bent inside the Otterbox packaging . This was NOT a result of getting bumped around in shipping - it was the way the manufacturer had stuffed it into the box . So those two corners have never and will never stick properly to the phone ... I will probably have to replace it much sooner than normally for that reason.The case itself fits very well . It 's not too bulky and it 's not so thin that I still feel nervous about carrying my phone . The edges of the case extend above the screen so that if you flip it screen side down , the screen will never ever touch the surface . All the buttons still work perfectly , the phone does n't get overheated.BONUS : I can tell you that if you are wanting a wireless charger , they DO work through the Commuter case .
I bought this as a gift and my friend is happy with it . Its not too bulky and protects the phone well . It 's easy to install .
The commuter series does not make your phone look too bulky . Just wish I had ordered a different color because the lighter colors may get dirty from the handling .
Its been 3 weeks I was using and it is very comfortable cover . It fits the phone perfectly . Though the screen protector gets bubbles in one week . 100 % I recomment it . but it is worth .

This was the first OtterBox case that I have ever tried for mySamsung Galaxy S4and I can truly say that I am impressed . TheOtterBox Commuter Series Case for Samsung Galaxy S4has a snug fit that was a little difficult to get on at first . But once it was installed , it fit perfectly . The quality and feel of the case is very sound . It may be a little 'slick ' feeling on the back for some , but I really do n't like full rubberized/tacky cases . i feel comfortable holding it and do n't believe it will slip out of my hands or from between my shoulder and ear when not using my bluetooth headset.I had never used an OtterBox branded product before because I thought they looked too bulky for my tastes . But with my rugged handling of my smartphone during business travel , I needed something that could help protect it . And I was pleasantly surprised that the OtterBox did not make the phone too bulky to keep in my pants or jacket pocket . Nor was the case cut such that I could n't use it with my travel charger ( unlike 2 other cases i previously purchased ) .In all , this is a great investment to protect your smartphone by balancing the bulk needed for protection and the style needed for a serious businessperson .
I could not find a protector of this quality locally , so I 'm glad I found it on Amazon . It fits the S4 perfectly .
I have always used the OtterBox Defender series on my phones so I decided to try the Commuter for my wife 's S4 . She likes it and it fits well .

I 've had several otterbox cases for other phones and they 've been amazing . They really have protected my phone from clumsy people ( like myself ! ) . And this one i got in the & # 34 ; Wild Orchid & # 34 ; color which is a very light gray outer case and the pink inner case is brighter in person . Very pretty . I 've gotten several compliments on it . I love it !

I love this case ! It looks great on my phone , I bought it in raspberry , and feels great ! It adds a little size to the phone , which is great for me because the phone is so slim , and this is the perfect solution . I feel like this case offers the best protection of the cases available for this phone . I have tried three different cases , including this one , and while I have n't returned all of them , this is my favorite . I have n't dropped my phone , yet . However , I feel that if I do drop it , this case will be my savior . The hard outer case is sturdy and holds the rubberized case snug to the phone and comes up around the edges . It is fairly easy to put on and I found it easier to keep the 2 pieces together while putting it on the phone , otherwise , I found it to be a little bit of a struggle . I really do n't feel that anyone choosing this case will be disappointed , I 'm pretty picky and was happy to find a case I liked so quickly . My only suggestion is that I think they should make it in more colors .
Could n't say anything negative- it 's an Otterbox- my rave review is for Amazon providing us with quality for less cost . It 's ridiculous to pay the retail price . Thank heaven for Amazon !

Fits like a glove . Have n't actually dropped the phone to test out the durability of the case . Screen protector is fits perfect . Only negative is that dust gets trapped under the rubber section , not a big deal tho .
I love the case I just did n't like the color . but it is a very strong item for everyday use
Great fit as always from Otterbox and it comes with a really high quality screen protector . I have dropped my phone at least 5 times so far and it has n't been damaged yet ... ..

Absolutely love this case . with every new phone I have to have an otterbox case so this was a no brainer . I love the color . I was a little scared the grey part would look blue in person , but it does n't at all . It 's a beautiful color and most importantly protects my phone . Easy to put on and easy to take off

I can not say enough good things about OtterBox , especially when this case is amazing and looks amazing ! The colors do n't get dirty and it fits comfortably in my armbands for when I work out ! Worth the purchase !

That warm and fuzzy feeling of safety and protection is great . Especially when you know you 'll eventually fall prey to butter fingers and drop that phone that cost more than a nice laptop . It 's not the prettiest case out there ( I 'd love to be able to admire the brushed aluminum edge on my SGS4 ) , but there are Otterbox loyalists who will debate that . I like that it slides into and out of my pocket easily ( or as easily a quasi-phablet can ) . I have n't & # 34 ; test dropped & # 34 ; it , nor do I think I will . But I sure do feel better knowing that when ( not if ) I do , my phone stands a better chance of coming out unscathed than if it were not wrapped in its two sleek layers of protection . Two grumbles : the rubbery part does seem to collect dust and it can be annoying when you take the case off -- but that 's not an everyday event . Also the two & # 34 ; port covers & # 34 ; for the MicroUSB port and the headphone jack can get in the way of a quick installation or removal of the case , and they 're not the easiest to peel down to insert the cable you want to . These are not deal-breakers though . And of course you 'll get a much better deal on a genuine Otterbox via Amazon than you would at your wireless carrier 's store or any brick-and-mortar store for that matter . Order your case a little bit ahead of when you 're getting your new phone and you 'll be protected from day one !

Otterbox delivers as always.Case is strong , I like the feel , the back slides into pants easily but the front can keep it from slipping if put face down on a smooth surface.Screen protector included works well , good feel , has a bit of a gloss when screen is off or in bright sunlight , but works as I 'd want.Good buy .
Great cover and is what was described when purchased . Thank you for a great product . We are extremely happy and satisfied .
Otterbox is always a top case maker . I think they are actually the # 1 case maker in the US , and for a good reason .

Otterbox cases are a little bulky but I like the extra protection . The commuter is the best for pants pockets . Mostly smooth plastic with a little bit of rubber on the corners means it slides in and out with ease . I still have one on my iphone 4 for over 2 years but it did need some glue in the corners . I am so in love with the color not to mention i have a big problem with dropping my electronics and this does help me . I no longer have to be worried about cracked screens or malfunctioning phone
I have an OtterBox 77-27768 Defender Series Case and Holster for Samsung Galaxy S4 and i bought this one for my girlfriend . Great material and fits well .
This is an amazing product , really well manufactured and fits my cellphone like a glove ! Is the big boss in cases ! 100 % recommended

i had a galaxy S2 that i loved.. then dropped it once from my lap as i was exiting my car . The screen was destroyed and it cost me over $ 200 to repair . So if you fear dropping it , GET THIS CASE ! the defender is more & # 34 ; child proof & # 34 ; sturdy , but this commuter case is plenty good if you do n't have kids grabbing your phone and tossing out across the room .
This product was ordered for a friend . She absolutely loves the product . She changed from the iPhone to the Samsung and wanted the outer box because the one she had for the iPhone worked so well .

Had an old Epic 4g , which surprisingly took a beating , and did not even use a case . Upgraded to Verizon Galaxy S4 , and knew it definitely needed a case . I work in an office , and do n't see myself using it in hardcore situations , so I chose the Commuter case . Fit was pretty nice , though it should be noted that it is a little loose with pulling over the top third sides of the phone ; this it where the buttons are , and only silicone protected . However , the phone has not slipped out . Alignment over all the ports and buttons are great . Obviously , while it does n't retain the slimness of the S4 , it is comfortable enough to put in your jeans or pants . Definitely not curved in the back as the first image on the page here appears . Comfortable in my hands . This is a well-built case that provides about the best protection I have seen for after market cases . The price is reasonable and it comes in multiple colors . So why only four stars ? NO BELT CLIP ! For anyone carrying this phone in a pocket or purse , no problem . But for carrying the phone on an active job , I NEED a belt clip . I tried to solve this by buying a BoxWave case and trying to slip the OtterBox into the belt clip case of that unit , but the clips on the side break off after little use due to the thickness of the OtterBox case . If OtterBox would make a model with a belt clip ( if they do I have not found it ) then this case would win the five stars .

I would n't recommend this to anyone that wants a small , sleek case . That said , if you do n't mind your phone being bulky due to the case then this is a great product . I really like mine and it definitely protects the phone well .

This commuter case is a vast improvement over the s3 commuter case . Otterbox has done well to improve their cases . The buttons fit flush now and the plug covers have extra silicone on them to hold them in place . This one has n't lost it 's shape and holds up very well .

Everything fit together well . The screen protector went on without any problems ( I put Tech Armor on another phone and had many problems ) . Nice to see OtterBox pays attention to detail . Was told the product had a lifetime guarantee , but that is wrong . Word of advice , when putting on the screen protector - make sure your screen is clean , I used a LCD spray cleaner . Also when applying the screen protector make sure it is aligned to the phone edges . It helps when pulling off the # 1 layer to do it slowly and hold down the layer touching the screen .

The Otterbox Commuter for the Galaxy S3 almost made me lose faith with Otterbox Products . The Iphone 5 Commuter is n't as bad as the S3 but was n't up to par.The new Galaxy S4 case does everything that an Otterbox should . It fits precisely , protects the phone , is easy to install , offers good grip while being easy to slide in and out of the pocket , and looks good on the phone . The rubber also does n't attract lint like the older Otterbox cases.Here is my Commuter rating scale from previous phones that I have owned : Samsung Captivate-GoodIphone 4-ExcellentGalaxy S2- ExcellentHTC One X- FairGalaxy S3-PoorIphone 5- FairGalaxy S4- Excellent

I received my Galaxy S4 , Otterbox Commuter case , and iBOLT xProdock car-dock 2 days before running off on a 3-week , 4000 mile road trip to the Southwest for hiking , camping , and photography . The case worked as expected ( I 've been using Otterbox cases for years ) except for one thing I never thought about until I used it with my Galaxy S4..See con's.Pro 's : * Durable . I dropped my phone several times during my trip on concrete , gravel , sand , and tile flooring . The case did its job . It has a few battle scars on the case but hardly noticeable since I got my case black-on-black . * The back-side of the case is a little thicker than it the Otterbox commuter I had with my previous Motorola Atrix phone . While boiling water at our campsite one night the pot bubbled over and ran down the tabletop right over to my phone . When I got there my phone was literally sitting in a pile of very hot water . The thickness of the case protected it from any of the standing water making its way to my actual phone . A quick wipe with a paper towel and all was good . *Note , its not waterproof nor is the case intended to be . *Usability of buttons . This is one place I put Otterbox above all other cases I have owned . All ports are still easily accessible and buttons are easy to press , even with gloves on . The rubber port cover over the USB charging port is extra-nice for keeping debris out , yet very easy to open for charging.Con 's : *Holds in heat . While plugged into my car-dock and exposed to full sun my phone became extremely hot , even with the A/C on . I know that sounds obvious but the full-sun exposure never caused a problem with the past 3 phones I used in this manner . I constantly received the pop-up message on my phone saying `` Charging Paused , battery too hot . '' It never lead to any major problems but is annoying when I get that message when its only 75 degree 's outside . I definitively ca n't say its the phone or the case 's fault , but the logic of having a device encased in a thick black case makes sense that it will absorb and retain heat .

I was worried this case would be too bulky , but its the perfect level of protection without being too thick . It still fits in my dashboard mount without issue.Its very well protected , and even came with a quality screen protector that somehow feels smoother than the glass itself.I havent dropped it to test its durability yet , but im not worried about my brand new phone breaking at all anymore . Its definitely a confidence inspiring case to say the least

I was originally going to get the & # 34 ; marine & # 34 ; colored case , but this one was cheaper . I really like the black mist/black case combo . I 'm really not an otterbox fan , but this is a nice case . It does n't bulk the phone up to much . It maintains nice , snug natural feel and is truly rugged . I got this for my wifes phone . If otterbox made one for my Galaxy mega with a holster , I would buy it without any second thoughts .
bought this by mistake but I LOVE the color and the feel too bad I had a s3 instead of a s4 ! worth the buy ... very stylish

My son absolutely loves this case . He stopped putting cases on his phone because he wanted to show off the white phone , this solved both problems , now he can show it off as well as protect it at the same time .

Well what can ya say ? It 's Otterbox - one of the best protective cases you can get for your phone . The commuter is for the person on the go who is not so clumsy but , the occasional drop might happen . If you are rougher on your phone than most - get the otterbox defender - it has a built in screen protector also.If you do buy this one - do n't use the cheap stick on screen protector - get yourself a moshi washable re-usable protector ! Received it fast and loved it ! I did not use the screen protector that came with it based on the reviews I read that said it was n't great so I ordered a TECH ARMOR screen protector along with the case . This is the third protective case I have tried for my Galaxy S4 and it is definitely the sturdiest and appears to offer the maximum protection . The back , sides and corners of the phone are well cushioned and the included screen protector covers the touch screen without affecting its performance . There are protective flaps over the charging port and headphone jack , which close securely when they are not in use . The on/off and volume buttons are completely covered by protruding buttons which operate without any problems by pressing on them . There are openings for the Home button ( it is the only button not covered ) , earpiece , light and proximity sensors , both cameras , flash , speaker and microphones.The holster holds the phone very firmly , so firmly that it is difficult to release the phone from the holster with only one hand . This is not an issue for me , however , because I do not use the holster on my belt . I have used the holster on the sun visor of my car and it keeps the phone close while driving . The kickstand on the holster performs its function well and holds the phone at a comfortable viewing angle when the phone is on a table and I am seated.When the phone is laying on a flat surface its back , the rubberized material of the case keeps the phone firmly in place . However , the phone slides easily when placed face ( screen ) down on a flat surface . I therefore usually lay the phone on its back when putting it down on a flat surface and rely on the screen protector to prevent any potential damage to the screen.Installing my phone in this case was challenging . Although the process was fairly intuitive , I had difficulty removing the screen protector from its holder . The directions included in the box , which consisted only of a simple diagram , were useless and the on-line directions on Otter 's website were not any more helpful . Unfortunately , by the time I finally got the phone installed in the case , there was a permanent scratch on the membrane of the screen protector , but this does not interfere with viewing the screen . I eventually found an instruction video by a user on removing the membrane on YouTube , but only after I had installed the phone in the case.This case substantially increases the size of the Galaxy S4 . I usually keep my phone in my side pants pocket and inserting and removing the phone from this pocket is somewhat difficult with this case on the phone - considerably more difficult than with other cases I have tried . On the other hand , this case offers excellent protection for the phone . I think it would be most effective for those who leave their phones out in the open for long periods of time or who work in dusty or rugged conditions , such as in construction .

Rubber shellOnce you 've removed the holster you need to remove the rubber-like shell that will surround the back of your phone and wrap around the edges to barely encroach on the phone 's screen . This is a precisely engineed piece of neoprene or whatever it is that because of its elasticity provides most of the resistance against impact damage.To remove it , start by opening the two very sturdy port covers -- one at the top and one at the bottom -- so they do n't impede your progress or tear in case you get too rough . Then choose a corner and pry away at it till you see how the rubber shell is attached . We 've had the Sidekick II for about two months . Although my 11-year-old likes it for its buttons and Gee Whiz value , I find it very awkward to use as a phone . It does n't have a normal keyboard , so you must flip the screen up to press the keys , then flip the screen back down to listen and talk . When you get into a voicemail situation , you have to keep flipping the screen up to `` press 1 for English '' , etc . Very annoying.You also must pay an additional $ 20 per month if you want to browse the Internet , use Instant Messaging , or even Download Fun . Otherwise , all you get is phone calls and text messaging ( which is also extra ) . Even the non-sidekick phones let you get T-Zones for Instant Messaging as a $ 5.00 option.Another gripe is that the phone is falling apart after two months of not very rough usage . The screen no longer slips into place when flipped open and the letter `` A '' has fallen out . It occasionally just freezes for no reason . The first phone I received froze up the first day and had to be replaced.The battery is built into the phone , so you ca n't take it out to let the phone reset itself . No such thing as having an extra battery on a trip , for example.Internet browsing is cool , but so slow you think it stopped working . I think some of the fault is just the slow connection , but the other part of the fault is that the phone seems to take a long time to actually build the web page it 's trying to display.Oh , yeah . Another problem is that T-Mobile expects you to pay $ 9.95 to set up your album on its web site , then 29 cents for each photo you upload to it.The phone is too large and heavy and has poor quality voice reproduction . You ca n't use wallpaper and the ring tones sound terrible.Although it looks good on paper , it is n't really ready for prime time .

Sidekick II is meant to be your one-stop-shop wireless gadget for e-mailing , web-browsing and IM chatting anywhere you go . You can also download limited content . You can also sync with your Outlook calendar and addressbook , but only if you pay extra for a third-party utiltiy program . Compared to the original Sidekick , SK II is thinner but quite a bit longer . I also think it 's uglier , esp . the new thumb keyboard , but the keyboard is still very useable . Battery life is terrible after the first couple weeks , requiring you to carry the charger with you all the time.The problem with the whole T-Mobile data service , though , is the poor quality of T-Mobile 's GPRS coverage . T-Mobile is infamous for its sporadic GSM ( voice ) coverage in the U.S . When it comes to GPRS ( data ) , it 's even worse , and the slightest degradation in reception will cause the Sidekick to go kaputt . And when that happens , SK has a tendency to fail to re-establish the data connection when signal strength returns . This makes a very frustrating user experience , esp . when you need Internet access the most ( e.g. , when you want to log onto amazon.com to compare-shop that big Sharp Aquos LCD TV you are looking at inside a Best Buy store ) . Unfortunately , T-Mobile has not improved its coverage or download speed , so if you get the SK , be prepared for slow speed and lost connections . Once the novelty factor wears off , the SK experience is a rather stressful one.Of course , currently no other device - not even the Treo 600 - has the same portable form factor and useable keyboard as the SK II . If you are an absolutely Internet junkie , you 'll probably find T-Mobile 's abysmal coverage tolerable and SK 's true wireless Internet access appealing .

When a person spends $ 400 on a phone , or any device , it should work longer than a few weeks . Subsequent to this occurrence , other friends / colleagues have told me how they had problems with their Treo 650s , as well.There are other issues with this phone . Expect nothing new and different from the Palm OS part of the Treo.All in all , I am firm in my opinion that I will never own another Palm device . My company will stop using Palm , and we are going to slowly migrate away from Sprint ( when contracts start to expire ) .My apologies for the rant , but it simply seems that these companies have become much bigger than their customers . As a long-time Motorola bluetooth headset user , I can tell you from painful experience that there are fundamental flaws in the HS850 . In fact , I went through FOUR HS850 headsets ( under warranty ) before Motorola decided to upgrade me to the H700 ( despite the lower model number , the H700 is a newer model ) .The HS850 and H700 have the same characteristics : - Over-the-ear swing arm earpiece that can be used on left or right ear- Flip-open boom microphone that turns the headset on/off- Easy volume controls- Toggle switch to connect/disconnect calls ( or put them on hold/mute ) - Easy pairing- Good published battery life- Standard Motorola power connectorsWhat 's the difference ? Well , `` good published '' battery life is the distinction . All four of the HS850 headsets worked for a few weeks or months , but then would not hold a charge . Battery life went down to MINUTES.Dealing with Motorola support was a nightmare . Apparently , their support center for these products was in Argentina , and they could only do what was in their script to help me . After the fourth failure , I insisted on getting a support contact at their corporate HQ in Illinois . That support contact was a dream . After reviewing my case , he gave me the H700 as a replacement . I had that headset for 1.5 years , and it had kept its battery life and functionality . Of course , I lost it and had to buy a replacement ... and given all the choices , I got another H700.Do NOT fall for the lower price of the HS850 . I 've seen prices as low as $ 15 for this model . I think you 'll be frustrated and disappointed in the end .
